havoc.lib.decorators.ignored(exceptions, exception_string=None)[source]¶

Provide ‘with’ statement to ignore certain exceptions.

@param Tuple[Exception]/Exception exceptions: catch these exceptions @param str exception_string: optional; if provided, will ignore exception

if this string is in the exception message

havoc.lib.decorators.retry(tries, sleep_seconds, exponential=False, exceptions=<class 'Exception'>)[source]¶

Simple decorator for retrying function call. The function will be called until it succeeds for up to num_tries times.

@param tries: number of tries before failing @sleep_seconds: Time in seconds to sleep between attempts @exponential: If true will double sleep_seconds between each attempt @exceptions: an exception or a tuple of exceptions that if seen will retry;

raise otherwise

havoc.lib.filesystem_actions module¶

class havoc.lib.filesystem_actions.FilesystemActions[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for reading and writing data on a filesystem. Uses a configurable number of retries and sleep time between retries to deal with filesystem access errors. It uses exponential sleep time between retries to avoid busy polling. Only if all retries fail it will raise an error.

Writes to a file with retries to handle FS failures. @param path: Full path where to write to @param contents: Data to write to file @param append: If set to True will append instead of replace data @param json_file: If set to True will dump data as JSON

havoc.lib.log_structs.result_message(category, job_id, asset_id, hostname, test_id, test_name, result_key, result_value)[source]¶

Format message into a dict, and append to job_messages list to send to JobLogger queue. @param job_id: ID of this job @type: int @param test_id: ID of current test @type: int @param test_name: name of current test @type: str @param result_key: descriptor of result @type: str @param result_value: value of result @type: str @return: message struct with key / value pairs
